text:
I'm trying to continue the OpenBLAS 64 bits on ARM adventure. Is there some special trick for the SuiteSparse version depending on OpenBLAS?
Specifically, OpenBLAS v0.3.10+4 was released recently, is there something special to make SuiteSparse depend on it?

elements.text:
I'm trying to continue the OpenBLAS 64 bits on ARM adventure. Is there some special trick for the SuiteSparse version depending on OpenBLAS?
Specifically, OpenBLAS v0.3.10+4 was released recently, is there something special to make SuiteSparse depend on it?

text: I think OpenBLAS doesn't change much in terms of compatibility, so I'm not sure I understand your question

elements.text: I think OpenBLAS doesn't change much in terms of compatibility, so I'm not sure I understand your question

text: Or maybe that was the question?

elements.text: Or maybe that was the question?

text: OpenBLAS v0.3.10+4 still uses the old LP64 AArch64

elements.text: OpenBLAS v0.3.10+4 still uses the old LP64 AArch64

text: to maintain compatibility

elements.text: to maintain compatibility

text: or at least

elements.text: or at least

text: I hope it does

elements.text: I hope it does

text: *gulp*

elements.text: gulp

text: hahahaha whoops

elements.text: hahahaha whoops

text: okay I’m going to rebuild OpenBLAS v0.3.10+4 and change it back to AArch64 being LP 64

elements.text: okay I’m going to rebuild OpenBLAS v0.3.10+4 and change it back to AArch64 being LP 64

text: because we need to maintain compatibility in this release

elements.text: because we need to maintain compatibility in this release

text: but for the latest versions of OpenBLAS, v0.3.13, we are changing AArch64 to ILP64

elements.text: but for the latest versions of OpenBLAS, v0.3.13, we are changing AArch64 to ILP64

text: for those you will want to build SuiteSparse with this conditional altered: <https://github.com/JuliaPackaging/Yggdrasil/blob/master/S/SuiteSparse/SuiteSparse/build_tarballs.jl#L32-L37>

elements.text: for those you will want to build SuiteSparse with this conditional altered:

text: X-ref: <https://github.com/JuliaPackaging/Yggdrasil/pull/2590>

elements.text: X-ref:

text: ^^ This PR is so that we can continue to build old OpenBLAS’s with AArch64 set to ILP64, but not worry about breaking compat with older releases

elements.text: ^^ This PR is so that we can continue to build old OpenBLAS’s with AArch64 set to ILP64, but not worry about breaking compat with older releases

text: missing openblas32?

elements.text: missing openblas32?

text: oh, well, I guess it doesn't matter for that

elements.text: oh, well, I guess it doesn't matter for that

text: (I was just trying to find a way to make you cancel that _looong_ job :eyes:)

elements.text: (I was just trying to find a way to make you cancel that
looong
job

text: hahahahaha

elements.text: hahahahaha

text:
>  okay I’m going to rebuild OpenBLAS v0.3.10+4 and change it back to AArch64 being LP 64
just to be sure, that will be required for <https://github.com/JuliaLang/julia/pull/39714#issuecomment-780999574> (building Julia BLAS with 64 when on 64-bits ARM machines)?

elements.text: okay I’m going to rebuild OpenBLAS v0.3.10+4 and change it back to AArch64 being LP 64
just to be sure, that will be required for
(building Julia BLAS with 64 when on 64-bits ARM machines)?

text: Correct.  The reason I flipped OpenBLAS v0.3.10 back to LP64 is because v0.3.10 is for the 1.6 branch, which needs to maintain that behavior (too late in the release cycle to change something like that now)

elements.text: Correct.  The reason I flipped OpenBLAS v0.3.10 back to LP64 is because v0.3.10 is for the 1.6 branch, which needs to maintain that behavior (too late in the release cycle to change something like that now)

text: v0.3.13 is free to flip to ILP64 for all 64-bit architectures to make things more consistent, so we can experiment on the `master` branch with those new builds of OpenBLAS

elements.text: v0.3.13 is free to flip to ILP64 for all 64-bit architectures to make things more consistent, so we can experiment on the
master
branch with those new builds of OpenBLAS
